> Sure, how about a Java ME application?

Of course a Java ME application IS a java application.  Much of the  
java code can be written and tested in a J2SE environment.  A willing  
designer could even create mockups of the ME environment sufficient  
to allow considerable test coverage in the host environment.

I have customers who complete the testing connection to their  
embedded devices by writing unit tests on the host environment that  
make calls over a USB connection to a simple little program on the  
device that then knows how to call into the embedded application.   
Think of it as a very poor man's RPC.

Again, where there is a will, there is a way.
